bug.author: mitomm
bug.summary: ImportError: No module named theano_utils for elephas_optimizer import
bug.description: First, thanks for the bringing Keras to Spark. Seems very interesting. I'm trying to implement the example from the README.md but I get the following error: Traceback (most recent call last): File "..pathToFile/File.py", line 12, in from elephas import optimizers as elephas_optimizers File "/Users/XXX/anaconda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/elephas/optimizers.py", line 11, in from keras.utils.theano_utils import shared_zeros, shared_scalar, floatX ImportError: No module named theano_utils I also tried changing keras backend to TensorFlow. However Elephas is still looking (and cannot find) "theano_utils". Any ideas on why this doesn't work? Thanks

comments.comment: Yes, you're absolutely right, thanks for this. The reason this breaks is that the latest release of Keras, introducing backends, removed the file theano_utils, as it is backend-specific. I will fix this and make a new minor release as soon as I find the time. Until then, would you please consider using Keras version 0.2.0 to run the example? Then this one should work for you: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/maxpumperla/elephas/blob/master/examples/mnist_mlp_spark.py>https://github.com/maxpumperla/elephas/blob/master/examples/mnist_mlp_spark.py</denchmark-link>
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mitomm>@mitomm</denchmark-link> , just released elephas 0.2.2 to revolve all theano/backend related issues. Does this work as expected for you?
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/maxpumperla>@maxpumperla</denchmark-link> , yes, the error is gone now. Thanks for the quick fix.
